org.sd.util
Class StringScanner

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.util.StringScanner

public class StringScanner
extends java.lang.Object

Utility for scanning for expected patterns of characters in strings.

Author:
Spence Koehler

scanIgnorables

public boolean scanIgnorables(boolean ensureBalanced)
Scan through ignorable characters, including closing parentheses, but stop at (before consuming) an open parenthesis or valid character.

Returns:
true if parens are balanced and under the limit; otherwise, false. (Note that we may or may not have skipped any chars regardless of the return value.)

scanIgnorables

public boolean scanIgnorables()
Scan through ignorable characters, including closing parentheses, but stop at (before consuming) an open parenthesis or valid character.

Returns:
true if parens are balanced and under the limit; otherwise, false. (Note that we may or may not have skipped any chars regardless of the return value.)

nextValidValue

public java.lang.Integer nextValidValue()
Scan up to and consume the next valid value, without ensuring balanced parentheses.

getValidValue

public java.lang.Integer getValidValue()
Get the current value if it is valid according to the current char function and increment to the next position.

Returns:
the valid value or null.

mark

public void mark()
Mark this instance's current state.

A marked state will be restored through the 'revert' method. Multiple marks can be set and the last mark set will be restored by 'revert'.

revert

public void revert()
Revert to the last stored state.

NOTE: an exception will be thrown if there are no states to revert to.

unmark

public void unmark()
Remove the last mark as if it were never set.
